com.google.cloud.pubsub.spi.v1

Class Publisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.cloud.pubsub.spi.v1.Publisher

  • public class Publisher
extends Object
    A Cloud Pub/Sub publisher, that is associated with a specific topic at creation.

    A Publisher provides built-in capabilities to automatically handle bundling of messages, controlling memory utilization, and retrying API calls on transient errors.

    With customizable options that control:

    • Message bundling: such as number of messages or max bundle byte size.
    • Flow control: such as max outstanding messages and maximum outstanding bytes.
    • Retries: such as the maximum duration of retries for a failing bundle of messages.

    If no credentials are provided, the Publisher will use application default credentials through GoogleCredentials.getApplicationDefault().

    For example, a Publisher can be constructed and used to publish a list of messages as follows: 

    
  Publisher publisher =
       Publisher.Builder.newBuilder(MY_TOPIC)
           .setMaxBundleDuration(new Duration(10 * 1000))
           .build();
  List<ListenableFuture<String>> results = new ArrayList<>();

  for (PubsubMessage messages : messagesToPublish) {
    results.add(publisher.publish(message));
  }

  Futures.addCallback(
  Futures.allAsList(results),
  new FutureCallback<List<String>>() {
    @Override
    public void onSuccess(List<String> messageIds) {
      // ... process the acknowledgement of publish ...
    }
    @Override
    public void onFailure(Throwable t) {
      // .. handle the failure ...
    }
  });

  // Ensure all the outstanding messages have been published before shutting down your process.
  publisher.shutdown();

      • getApiMaxBundleMessages

      • getApiMaxBundleBytes

      • getTopic

        public String getTopic()
        Topic to which the publisher publishes to.

      • publish

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<String> publish(com.google.pubsub.v1.PubsubMessage message)
        Schedules the publishing of a message. The publishing of the message may occur immediately or be delayed based on the publisher bundling options.

        Depending on chosen flow control option, the returned future might immediately fail with a FlowController.FlowControlException or block the current thread until there are more resources available to publish.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to publish.
        Returns:
        the message ID wrapped in a future.

      • getBundlingSettings

        public com.google.api.gax.grpc.BundlingSettings getBundlingSettings()
        The bundling settings configured on this Publisher.

      • getFlowControlSettings

        public com.google.api.gax.bundling.FlowController.Settings getFlowControlSettings()
        The bundling settings configured on this Publisher. See failOnFlowControlLimits().

      • failOnFlowControlLimits

        public boolean failOnFlowControlLimits()
        Whether to block publish calls when reaching flow control limits (see getFlowControlSettings()).

        If set to false, a publish call will fail with either FlowController.MaxOutstandingRequestBytesReachedException or FlowController.MaxOutstandingElementCountReachedException, as appropriate, when flow control limits are reached.

      • getStats

        public PublisherStats getStats()
        Retrieves a snapshot of the publisher current statistics.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Schedules immediate publishing of any outstanding messages and waits until all are processed.

        Sends remaining outstanding messages and prevents future calls to publish. This method should be invoked prior to deleting the Publisher object in order to ensure that no pending messages are lost.
